result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Barron

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Barron in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Juan Barron in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Barron appeared by video means with Attorney.
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Case DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
Defendant is eligible for DTC. Case adjourned for entry.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Juan Barron not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court of the defendant's pending felony matter in branch 25 and a potential global offer. Defense requests a status conference. 
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case calenadared for a Status of Counsel on today's date. Defendant in custody. 
State Public Defender  office has not appointed counsel in this matter.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person.  Status of Counsel scheduled  June 30, 2022 at 3:00pm.
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Barron not in court, defendant in custody.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.   Matter set for pretrial conference.  SPD has not appointed counsel yet.  Court ordered matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target (2600 S. 108th Street)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Juan Barron in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
